sermons.title: 68 A Plain Vision for Coming Persecution (brother Brian)
sermons.description: God is merciful and He is so patient. He has shown me more mercy than anybody I know. I will never give up on the mercy of God, but I will tell you this: He will not always strive with man and there is a judgment coming to the house of God. Jesus Christ is the Head of the Church and He must have the preeminence in all. Itâ€™s His Church, itâ€™s His body, itâ€™s His Brideâ€”and I tell you, that any Assembly where Jesus Christ is not truly the Head is sliding rapidly to the judgment of God. Hereâ€™s where weâ€™ve got to make the vision plain; weâ€™ve got to make it personal: do I honor Him as the Head of the house? Itâ€™s not enough for us to memorize Scripture that says that Jesus Christ is the Head of the Church.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 70 God's New Thing (brother David)
sermons.description: This message927 was preached at a SermonIndex Revival Conference event in Wales in the Moriah Chapel church where the famous Welsh revival began in 1904. This message given by David Legge in that historic pulpit calls for a glorious new work of the Spirit of God in our day. Such a work will glorify the Lord Jesus Christ as the true Head of the Church and Lord of all creation. May we be challenged afresh to accept and look forward to Godâ€™s work in these last days.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: A Plain Vision for the Church and Coming Persecution by Brian Long
sermons.description: Brian Long passionately shares on the vital subject of coming persecution to the Church in North America. From the book of Habbukuk he shares how the prophet struggled with coming judgment in his day and we must accept the same in our day. He also gives the solution of the great truth of the true baptism of the Holy Spirit for to reach the lost world and make disciples.  This message is needful to be heard by the whole Church in this hour.

sermons.title: A Prayer for Revival
sermons.description: Guzik illustrates how conversion of sinners follows transformation of life, which follows conviction of sin as the Spirit is poured out on the Church.  It is an immensely practical teaching encouraging self-examination and personal restoration to broadening one's prayer life for others.  He tackles theological debates on how revival comes, "Is it just a soverign work of God?" or "Is it the right use of appropriate means?"  Guzik cited a number of fascinating examples from J. Edwin Orr's book about the Second Great Awakening in Britain.

sermons.title: I Will Work A Work Not Believed
The Approaching Wave of Persecution
sermons.description: Brother Denny Kenaston shares his burden on the coming persecution that will come in the end times but very possibly soon to Christianity world-wide. He clearly shows biblically that if we are of the kingdom of Christ the kingdom of this world will be in opposition against us. We need to prepare for this and prepare to love our enemies and share the Gospel.

sermons.title: The Tent of Shem
sermons.description: God has appointed a tent as being symbolic of the ultimate union He calls us to.  It is only our own unbelief and prejudice that resists and does not ‘bow’ to this glorious condition of relationship.

sermons.title: Trusting In Our Own Means Or The Power Of The Holy Spirit
sermons.description: Jim Cymbala shares about how it is very dangerous and grieving to the Lord to trust in our own means and methods in the Church. He clearly shows that we must trust in the work of the Holy Spirit, no method works except God. God works in many ways and desires to get all the glory. May we in North America look towards God afresh for His Spirit's leading in the work of His Gospel and Church.

sermons.title: Why Does God Permit Evil In The World?
sermons.description: Pastor Fuller explains that sometimes we need to trust God 's Holy hand even though we can not see it. Will not the Lord of all the earth do right? We must try and look at things by the eyes of faith from God's perspective.
